title: 4 Simple Ways to Log Out of YouTube on Desktop or Mobile

steps.title: Click your profile picture.
steps.content: Click your profile picture. This is in the top-right corner of the page. [1] X Research source A drop-down menu will open.

steps.title: Click Sign out.
steps.content: Click Sign out . You can find this option near the top of the menu, underneath your YouTube handle. You'll be logged out of YouTube immediately.

steps.title: Tap your profile picture.
steps.content: Tap your profile picture. This is in the bottom-right corner of the app. It’s not possible to sign out of YouTube on your Android without removing the entire account from your phone or tablet. [2] X Research source This also signs you out from all apps that share your account, including Google Maps, Gmail , and your Android (if you're signed in with this account). If you just want to view videos anonymously, tap your profile photo at the top-right corner of the screen, then tap Turn on Incognito . If you decide you want to proceed with removing this account and its data from your Android, continue with this method.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Switch account.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Switch account . It’s toward the bottom of the menu. A list of your accounts will appear.

steps.title: Tap Manage Accounts or Sign Out.
steps.content: Tap Manage Accounts or Sign Out . The option you see may vary depending on your version, settings, and number of accounts.

steps.title: Tap the account you want to remove.
steps.content: Tap the account you want to remove. You may have to tap Google before you see your account name.

steps.title: Tap Remove account.
steps.content: Tap Remove account . If you don’t see this option, tap the ⁝ at the top-right corner and then select Remove account . A confirmation message will appear, letting you know that all data associated with this account will be removed from your Android.

steps.title: Tap REMOVE ACCOUNT to confirm.
steps.content: Tap REMOVE ACCOUNT to confirm. You will now be signed out of your YouTube account, and other associated apps, on this Android.

steps.title: Tap your profile picture.
steps.content: Tap your profile picture. This is in the bottom-right corner of the app. Your profile page will open.

steps.title: Tap Switch account.
steps.content: Tap Switch account . You can find this underneath your profile picture. A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Tap Use YouTube signed out.
steps.content: Tap Use YouTube signed out . This is at the very bottom of the page. If you want to remove your account from this device, tap Manage accounts on this device instead. Tap Remove from this device underneath your account email.

steps.title: Go to https://myaccount.google.com/device-activity in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://myaccount.google.com/device-activity in a web browser. You can use a desktop or mobile web browser. Use this method if you want to sign out of a device remotely . You may need to do this if you no longer have access to the device. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Log into your account.
steps.content: Log into your account. Make sure you're using the correct email address and password.

steps.title: Select the device you want to log out of.
steps.content: Select the device you want to log out of. You'll see a list of all devices that are currently logged into your account.

steps.title: Select Sign out.
steps.content: Select Sign out . This will log the device out of your YouTube (and Google) account.
